title: About me
text:
I’m currently a Master’s student in Epidemiology at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health (JHSPH), and I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Dentistry (BDS) from CES University in Medellín, Colombia.
My work integrates research and clinical practice, focusing on the intersection of social and oral health epidemiology, including conditions like cleft lip and palate. While pursuing my degree, I also work as a research assistant, coordinating community-based HIV research projects in Latino populations.
I also serve as Vice President of the Latino Public Health Network student group and as Master’s Co-Representative of the Epidemiology Student Organization (ESO) at JHSPH.
